heisigComment: * The primitive meaning of sheep can add the further connotations given in the following frame. As we saw with the cow, the "tail" is cut off when it is set immediately over another element: ⺷. Note the change in stroke order, as exemplified in the following frame.
heisigStory: This pictograph shows the animal horns at the top attached to the head (3rd stroke), the front and back legs (strokes 4 and 5) and body (final stroke).
koohiiStory1: Picture of a sheep run over by a steam roller. Must have been a ram, note the horns.
koohiiStory2: Our Lord and King put on ears and a tail to become a lowly sheep for the slaughter.
